page.title: 04The Railway.
page.content: The{Shrewsbury to Aberystwyth}railway crosses the block.It is single track and trains can pass each other at West -bury and Hanwood.At Stretton Heath there is a manned level crossing.The keeper lives by the track and comes to open the gates when you ring a bell. When she is on holiday some workmen operate it.They live in a yellow hut across the other side of the line. On Mondays to Fridays 9 passenger trains go up the line to Aberystwyth and 7 go down.9 go up and 8 go down on Saturdays and 1 goes in either direc- tion on Sundays.{Yockleton}people can board trains at{Shrewsbury.} Some farmers have land on either side of the line so British Rail have built locked gates and given farmers the keys.They have to listen for trains be -fore they unlock the gates to cross. There have been some bad accidents.
